page.title: 10Merdon Manor (1)
page.content: The manor of Merdon is very old , the kings of the West Saxons having manorial rights as long ago as 500AD . For three hundred years , between the seventeenth century and 1940 , the seat of the manor lay at Hursley Park just south of the study area . The main features of the area today have been shaped by the long history of this manor . For over nine hundred years the control of the manor lay with the bishops of Winchester , always among the most powerful men in the country . In Tudor times it passed to the Holey family . A hundred years later , Oliver Cromwell's son Richard aquired the manor and it was his while he was Protector , and remains Cromwellian for a long period . Later the Cooper family took over Hursley Park , but now Merdon Manor is owned by Mr.Smith.
